name: Hotel Ibis Faro

reviews.text: We stopped for a one night stay in August 2008 before moving on. Arriving early from our flight, we were able to leave our bags and return later to complete check in. Check in is not available until after 2pm which I guess is quite common.
reviews.title: Handy for airport and car hire

likes.disliked: — Small room, near to rail track

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was advertised as two with one child free. In this case, there was no space left in the tiny room after we made up the child's bed.
reviews.title: Adjust Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night as we had an early flight out of Faro airport and thought this was quite close. Took about 10 mins in a taxi in the morning and we ended up paying more to get in and out of the town the night before to get dinner etc, my advice would be to stay in town as you're only talking a couple minutes more in a cab.
reviews.title: Pay the extra and stay in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room also had a green fly infestation which was rather annoying when trying to sleep, they were just everywhere!
reviews.title: Staff could not have been more helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: You´ll get what you paid for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool area was ok, nice pool and plenty of sunbeds.
reviews.title: OK for a night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from this hotel. Having checked out of our holiday hotel and returned the hire car we found our early morning flight cancelled on the 15th due to the volcano dust. Our son in England checked us into the Ibis as a temporary measure. We actually stayed 7 days. The rooms were small and the decor a little dated but the beds comfortable and very clean. A former occupant had obviously been smoking in the room and the maid made valiant attempts to air the room as much as possible. The public areas were pleasant and clean and the pool area and gardens were delightful. Regarding the staff - I cannot praise them too highly. At a time when many guests were like ourselves stranded they were always helpful, kind and polite. They took the trouble to advise people on where things were in the locality and also on alternative travel arrangements. We could have moved back to one of the resort hotels but enjoyed the walk into explore Faro or the Algarve Forum a large shopping complex nearby. Certainly a pleasant hotel with exceptional staff if you want to explore this area for a few days.
reviews.title: great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Faro was the one spot on our Spain/Portugal Christmas trip we had not booked in advance. We were in our car and the GPS said that the Ibis was just off the motorway. It was getting late so we stopped there for the night on our way from Sevilla to Lisboa. The street the Ibis is on is rather run-down, but a short walk away is the really, really nice Forum Algarve mall, with tons of shopping and great places to eat. The hotel itself was really inexpensive by European standards (45 euro/night). The room was clean if basic; the staff were very charming and helpful, and the breakfast buffet (5.50 euro for two) was outstanding. Great pasteis da nata (little custard pies -- you can get them anywhere in Portugal but they were great here). We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Cheap and nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ibis Faro is just 5 minutes from the Airport and Downtown, so perfect location if you have a car. Breakfast is good. Rooms are a bit small and could be cleaner. I guess there are better places to stay in Algarve!
reviews.title: Ok but expected more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ibis Faro was pretty nice for the swimming pool - I thought I would not use in in October and in Algarve, famous for its wonderful beaches. But it was great to spend some morning hours on the pool before going to downtown Faro and visit the major historical buildings. Staff was OK - we've seen better one in Accor hotels - and room was clean and comfortable. Location is not great, unless you are driving - it is near the major shopping mall in Faro and not too far from Faro's airport and downtown. Great deal - the cheapest Ibis we stayed in Portugal.
reviews.title: Nice swimming pool, not so nice location - OK for the price

reviews.text: Another typical Ibis hotel. Comfortable but a little ways from the town center. If you have a car it is fine.
reviews.title: A little ways from town.

reviews.text: A big fan of Ibis hotels in general, I recently stayed at the Ibis Faro hotel. I had never come across bed bugs before but wow I was in for a shock.
reviews.title: Bed bugs, worse night of my life

description: The Ibis Faro hotel is located 2 km from the centre of Faro, 3 km from the airport and 6 km from the sunny beaches of Algarve. Book one of our 81 aircondtioned rooms or 2 meeting rooms for organising seminars and conferences and make use of our restaurant, bar with a terrace area and serving snacks 24 hours, outdoor swimming pool and private outdoor parking. Business guests will appreciate use of WiFi broadband Internet access. There is a tennis court 2 km from the hotel and a golf course 10 km away.
